                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                show this help dialog<span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>

              <!---->
            </div>

                  <!---->:

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

            Issue 1193104: crash in gpu::gles2::GLES2DecoderImpl::ValidateUniformBlockBackings
          <h1>

          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        We already moved to passthrough command buffer on Linux.<span class="line"><!---->We already moved to passthrough command buffer on Linux.<!----></span><br>We are moving on to passthrough command buffer on Mac right now.<span class="line"><!---->We are moving on to passthrough command buffer on Mac right now.<!----></span><br><br>There is no need to look into this crash at this point.<span class="line"><!---->There is no need to look into this crash at this point.<!----></span><br><br>Drop to p3 and will close once we ship on Mac.<span class="line"><!---->Drop to p3 and will close once we ship on Mac.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 28<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1193104#c28">Comment 28<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden="">schedule</i>
      capn@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/2929596023" title="capn@chromium.org"><!---->capn@chromium.org<!----></a>
      capn@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->capn@chromium.org<!----></span>
      Last visit > 30 days ago<div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden=""><!---->Last visit &gt; 30 days ago<!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Thu, Jun 3, 2021, 4:13 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jun 3, 2021, 4:13 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1193104#c28">Comment 28<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jun 3, 2021, 4:13 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1193104#c28">Comment 28<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jun 3, 2021, 4:13 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          WontFix
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          FoundIn-92
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          WontFix
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          FoundIn-92
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        This is a bug in the legacy SwiftShader OpenGL ES implementation. Note that ClusterFuzz is already switched to using SwANGLE, which is not affected, and hence it didn't reproduce it. We're switching to SwANGLE as WebGL fallback any day now, so that will address this bug.<span class="line"><!---->This is a bug in the legacy SwiftShader OpenGL ES implementation. Note that ClusterFuzz is already switched to using SwANGLE, which is not affected, and hence it didn't reproduce it. We're switching to SwANGLE as WebGL fallback any day now, so that will address this bug.<!----></span><br><br>The issue appears to be that the declared array of 128 uniform blocks is counted as 'active', despite not being used anywhere in the shader. The validating command decoder queries info on all active uniform blocks, such as the binding number, but legacy SwiftShader has only GL_MAX_UNIFORM_BUFFER_BINDINGS = 24 of them. Thus the bindings array is accessed out of bounds, producing values such as -1414812757, obtained from other Program class fields. The command decoder tries to store the info by binding number, so when its array of 128 uniform blocks is indexed by -1414812757, it page-faults.<span class="line"><!---->The issue appears to be that the declared array of 128 uniform blocks is counted as 'active', despite not being used anywhere in the shader. The validating command decoder queries info on all active uniform blocks, such as the binding number, but legacy SwiftShader has only GL_MAX_UNIFORM_BUFFER_BINDINGS = 24 of them. Thus the bindings array is accessed out of bounds, producing values such as -1414812757, obtained from other Program class fields. The command decoder tries to store the info by binding number, so when its array of 128 uniform blocks is indexed by -1414812757, it page-faults.<!----></span><br><br>I don't currently see any way how it could be exploited to not crash the GPU process and return any useful data back to the JS code. That and the imminent switch to SwANGLE makes me consider this a WontFix.<span class="line"><!---->I don't currently see any way how it could be exploited to not crash the GPU process and return any useful data back to the JS code. That and the imminent switch to SwANGLE makes me consider this a WontFix.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      </style>
      
      
    <!----></mr-launch-overview>
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

        }

        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;

          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;

          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }

        }

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>

        Since this bug was filed it's possible the default configuration's switched from the validating command decoder (--use-cmd-decoder=validating) to passthrough (--use-cmd-decoder=passthrough), in which case this code would no longer execute.<span class="line"><!---->Since this bug was filed it's possible the default configuration's switched from the validating command decoder (--use-cmd-decoder=validating) to passthrough (--use-cmd-decoder=passthrough), in which case this code would no longer execute.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1193104#c28">Comment 28<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jun 3, 2021, 4:13 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1193104#c28">Comment 28<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jun 3, 2021, 4:13 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          WontFix
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          FoundIn-92
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          WontFix
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          FoundIn-92
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        This is a bug in the legacy SwiftShader OpenGL ES implementation. Note that ClusterFuzz is already switched to using SwANGLE, which is not affected, and hence it didn't reproduce it. We're switching to SwANGLE as WebGL fallback any day now, so that will address this bug.<span class="line"><!---->This is a bug in the legacy SwiftShader OpenGL ES implementation. Note that ClusterFuzz is already switched to using SwANGLE, which is not affected, and hence it didn't reproduce it. We're switching to SwANGLE as WebGL fallback any day now, so that will address this bug.<!----></span><br><br>The issue appears to be that the declared array of 128 uniform blocks is counted as 'active', despite not being used anywhere in the shader. The validating command decoder queries info on all active uniform blocks, such as the binding number, but legacy SwiftShader has only GL_MAX_UNIFORM_BUFFER_BINDINGS = 24 of them. Thus the bindings array is accessed out of bounds, producing values such as -1414812757, obtained from other Program class fields. The command decoder tries to store the info by binding number, so when its array of 128 uniform blocks is indexed by -1414812757, it page-faults.<span class="line"><!---->The issue appears to be that the declared array of 128 uniform blocks is counted as 'active', despite not being used anywhere in the shader. The validating command decoder queries info on all active uniform blocks, such as the binding number, but legacy SwiftShader has only GL_MAX_UNIFORM_BUFFER_BINDINGS = 24 of them. Thus the bindings array is accessed out of bounds, producing values such as -1414812757, obtained from other Program class fields. The command decoder tries to store the info by binding number, so when its array of 128 uniform blocks is indexed by -1414812757, it page-faults.<!----></span><br><br>I don't currently see any way how it could be exploited to not crash the GPU process and return any useful data back to the JS code. That and the imminent switch to SwANGLE makes me consider this a WontFix.<span class="line"><!---->I don't currently see any way how it could be exploited to not crash the GPU process and return any useful data back to the JS code. That and the imminent switch to SwANGLE makes me consider this a WontFix.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>

         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

          position: relative;

          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;

          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;

           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }

          display: block;

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

        </div>

    </chops-dialog>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

        capn: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 40 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<span class="line"><!---->capn: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 40 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<!----></span><br><br>If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<span class="line"><!---->If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<!----></span><br><br>If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug.           Comment 28<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1193104#c28">Comment 28<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden="">schedule</i>
      capn@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/2929596023" title="capn@chromium.org"><!---->capn@chromium.org<!----></a>
      capn@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->capn@chromium.org<!----></span>
      Last visit > 30 days ago<div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden=""><!---->Last visit &gt; 30 days ago<!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Thu, Jun 3, 2021, 4:13 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jun 3, 2021, 4:13 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1193104#c28">Comment 28<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jun 3, 2021, 4:13 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1193104#c28">Comment 28<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jun 3, 2021, 4:13 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          WontFix
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          FoundIn-92
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          WontFix
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          FoundIn-92
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        This is a bug in the legacy SwiftShader OpenGL ES implementation. Note that ClusterFuzz is already switched to using SwANGLE, which is not affected, and hence it didn't reproduce it. We're switching to SwANGLE as WebGL fallback any day now, so that will address this bug.<span class="line"><!---->This is a bug in the legacy SwiftShader OpenGL ES implementation. Note that ClusterFuzz is already switched to using SwANGLE, which is not affected, and hence it didn't reproduce it. We're switching to SwANGLE as WebGL fallback any day now, so that will address this bug.<!----></span><br><br>The issue appears to be that the declared array of 128 uniform blocks is counted as 'active', despite not being used anywhere in the shader. The validating command decoder queries info on all active uniform blocks, such as the binding number, but legacy SwiftShader has only GL_MAX_UNIFORM_BUFFER_BINDINGS = 24 of them. Thus the bindings array is accessed out of bounds, producing values such as -1414812757, obtained from other Program class fields. The command decoder tries to store the info by binding number, so when its array of 128 uniform blocks is indexed by -1414812757, it page-faults.<span class="line"><!---->The issue appears to be that the declared array of 128 uniform blocks is counted as 'active', despite not being used anywhere in the shader. The validating command decoder queries info on all active uniform blocks, such as the binding number, but legacy SwiftShader has only GL_MAX_UNIFORM_BUFFER_BINDINGS = 24 of them. Thus the bindings array is accessed out of bounds, producing values such as -1414812757, obtained from other Program class fields. The command decoder tries to store the info by binding number, so when its array of 128 uniform blocks is indexed by -1414812757, it page-faults.<!----></span><br><br>I don't currently see any way how it could be exploited to not crash the GPU process and return any useful data back to the JS code. That and the imminent switch to SwANGLE makes me consider this a WontFix.<span class="line"><!---->I don't currently see any way how it could be exploited to not crash the GPU process and return any useful data back to the JS code. That and the imminent switch to SwANGLE makes me consider this a WontFix.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

    <mr-user-link showavailabilityicon=""></mr-user-link>

        capn: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 40 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<span class="line"><!---->capn: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 40 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<!----></span><br><br>If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<span class="line"><!---->If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<!----></span><br><br>If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug. If you've started working on a fix, please set the status to Started.<span class="line"><!---->If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug. If you've started working on a fix, please set the status to Started.<!----></span><br><br>Thanks for your time!           Comment 28<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1193104#c28">Comment 28<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden="">schedule</i>
      capn@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/2929596023" title="capn@chromium.org"><!---->capn@chromium.org<!----></a>
      capn@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->capn@chromium.org<!----></span>
      Last visit > 30 days ago<div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden=""><!---->Last visit &gt; 30 days ago<!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Thu, Jun 3, 2021, 4:13 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jun 3, 2021, 4:13 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1193104#c28">Comment 28<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jun 3, 2021, 4:13 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1193104#c28">Comment 28<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jun 3, 2021, 4:13 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          WontFix
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          FoundIn-92
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          WontFix
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          FoundIn-92
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        This is a bug in the legacy SwiftShader OpenGL ES implementation. Note that ClusterFuzz is already switched to using SwANGLE, which is not affected, and hence it didn't reproduce it. We're switching to SwANGLE as WebGL fallback any day now, so that will address this bug.<span class="line"><!---->This is a bug in the legacy SwiftShader OpenGL ES implementation. Note that ClusterFuzz is already switched to using SwANGLE, which is not affected, and hence it didn't reproduce it. We're switching to SwANGLE as WebGL fallback any day now, so that will address this bug.<!----></span><br><br>The issue appears to be that the declared array of 128 uniform blocks is counted as 'active', despite not being used anywhere in the shader. The validating command decoder queries info on all active uniform blocks, such as the binding number, but legacy SwiftShader has only GL_MAX_UNIFORM_BUFFER_BINDINGS = 24 of them. Thus the bindings array is accessed out of bounds, producing values such as -1414812757, obtained from other Program class fields. The command decoder tries to store the info by binding number, so when its array of 128 uniform blocks is indexed by -1414812757, it page-faults.<span class="line"><!---->The issue appears to be that the declared array of 128 uniform blocks is counted as 'active', despite not being used anywhere in the shader. The validating command decoder queries info on all active uniform blocks, such as the binding number, but legacy SwiftShader has only GL_MAX_UNIFORM_BUFFER_BINDINGS = 24 of them. Thus the bindings array is accessed out of bounds, producing values such as -1414812757, obtained from other Program class fields. The command decoder tries to store the info by binding number, so when its array of 128 uniform blocks is indexed by -1414812757, it page-faults.<!----></span><br><br>I don't currently see any way how it could be exploited to not crash the GPU process and return any useful data back to the JS code. That and the imminent switch to SwANGLE makes me consider this a WontFix.<span class="line"><!---->I don't currently see any way how it could be exploited to not crash the GPU process and return any useful data back to the JS code. That and the imminent switch to SwANGLE makes me consider this a WontFix.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

            Issue 1193104: crash in gpu::gles2::GLES2DecoderImpl::ValidateUniformBlockBackings
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1193104: crash in gpu::gles2::GLES2DecoderImpl::ValidateUniformBlockBackings
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      emily...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/613141512" title="emily...@gmail.com"><!---->emily...@gmail.com<!----></a>
      emily...@gmail.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->emily...@gmail.com<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link aria-label="issue reporter"></mr-user-link>
            on 
      Fri, Mar 26, 2021, 2:49 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Fri, Mar 26, 2021, 2:49 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>

        zmo: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<span class="line"><!---->zmo: Uh oh! This issue still open and hasn't been updated in the last 14 days. This is a serious vulnerability, and we want to ensure that there's progress. Could you please leave an update with the current status and any potential blockers?<!----></span><br><br>If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<span class="line"><!---->If you're not the right owner for this issue, could you please remove yourself as soon as possible or help us find the right one?<!----></span><br><br>If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug. If you've started working on a fix, please set the status to Started.<span class="line"><!---->If the issue is fixed or you can't reproduce it, please close the bug. If you've started working on a fix, please set the status to Started.<!----></span><br><br>Thanks for your time! To disable nags, add the Disable-Nags label.<span class="line"><!---->Thanks for your time!           Comment 28<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1193104#c28">Comment 28<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden="">schedule</i>
      capn@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/2929596023" title="capn@chromium.org"><!---->capn@chromium.org<!----></a>
      capn@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->capn@chromium.org<!----></span>
      Last visit > 30 days ago<div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden=""><!---->Last visit &gt; 30 days ago<!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Thu, Jun 3, 2021, 4:13 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jun 3, 2021, 4:13 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1193104#c28">Comment 28<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jun 3, 2021, 4:13 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1193104#c28">Comment 28<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jun 3, 2021, 4:13 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          WontFix
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          FoundIn-92
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          WontFix
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          FoundIn-92
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        This is a bug in the legacy SwiftShader OpenGL ES implementation. Note that ClusterFuzz is already switched to using SwANGLE, which is not affected, and hence it didn't reproduce it. We're switching to SwANGLE as WebGL fallback any day now, so that will address this bug.<span class="line"><!---->This is a bug in the legacy SwiftShader OpenGL ES implementation. Note that ClusterFuzz is already switched to using SwANGLE, which is not affected, and hence it didn't reproduce it. We're switching to SwANGLE as WebGL fallback any day now, so that will address this bug.<!----></span><br><br>The issue appears to be that the declared array of 128 uniform blocks is counted as 'active', despite not being used anywhere in the shader. The validating command decoder queries info on all active uniform blocks, such as the binding number, but legacy SwiftShader has only GL_MAX_UNIFORM_BUFFER_BINDINGS = 24 of them. Thus the bindings array is accessed out of bounds, producing values such as -1414812757, obtained from other Program class fields. The command decoder tries to store the info by binding number, so when its array of 128 uniform blocks is indexed by -1414812757, it page-faults.<span class="line"><!---->The issue appears to be that the declared array of 128 uniform blocks is counted as 'active', despite not being used anywhere in the shader. The validating command decoder queries info on all active uniform blocks, such as the binding number, but legacy SwiftShader has only GL_MAX_UNIFORM_BUFFER_BINDINGS = 24 of them. Thus the bindings array is accessed out of bounds, producing values such as -1414812757, obtained from other Program class fields. The command decoder tries to store the info by binding number, so when its array of 128 uniform blocks is indexed by -1414812757, it page-faults.<!----></span><br><br>I don't currently see any way how it could be exploited to not crash the GPU process and return any useful data back to the JS code. That and the imminent switch to SwANGLE makes me consider this a WontFix.<span class="line"><!---->I don't currently see any way how it could be exploited to not crash the GPU process and return any useful data back to the JS code. That and the imminent switch to SwANGLE makes me consider this a WontFix.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      sheriffbot<a id="user-link" href="/u/1950284618" title="sheriffbot"><!---->sheriffbot<!----></a>
      sheriffbot<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->sheriffbot<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

      </div><br>
    
        
      
        This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks.           Comment 28<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1193104#c28">Comment 28<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden="">schedule</i>
      capn@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/2929596023" title="capn@chromium.org"><!---->capn@chromium.org<!----></a>
      capn@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->capn@chromium.org<!----></span>
      Last visit > 30 days ago<div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden=""><!---->Last visit &gt; 30 days ago<!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Thu, Jun 3, 2021, 4:13 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jun 3, 2021, 4:13 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1193104#c28">Comment 28<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jun 3, 2021, 4:13 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1193104#c28">Comment 28<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jun 3, 2021, 4:13 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          WontFix
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          FoundIn-92
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          WontFix
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          FoundIn-92
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        This is a bug in the legacy SwiftShader OpenGL ES implementation. Note that ClusterFuzz is already switched to using SwANGLE, which is not affected, and hence it didn't reproduce it. We're switching to SwANGLE as WebGL fallback any day now, so that will address this bug.<span class="line"><!---->This is a bug in the legacy SwiftShader OpenGL ES implementation. Note that ClusterFuzz is already switched to using SwANGLE, which is not affected, and hence it didn't reproduce it. We're switching to SwANGLE as WebGL fallback any day now, so that will address this bug.<!----></span><br><br>The issue appears to be that the declared array of 128 uniform blocks is counted as 'active', despite not being used anywhere in the shader. The validating command decoder queries info on all active uniform blocks, such as the binding number, but legacy SwiftShader has only GL_MAX_UNIFORM_BUFFER_BINDINGS = 24 of them. Thus the bindings array is accessed out of bounds, producing values such as -1414812757, obtained from other Program class fields. The command decoder tries to store the info by binding number, so when its array of 128 uniform blocks is indexed by -1414812757, it page-faults.<span class="line"><!---->The issue appears to be that the declared array of 128 uniform blocks is counted as 'active', despite not being used anywhere in the shader. The validating command decoder queries info on all active uniform blocks, such as the binding number, but legacy SwiftShader has only GL_MAX_UNIFORM_BUFFER_BINDINGS = 24 of them. Thus the bindings array is accessed out of bounds, producing values such as -1414812757, obtained from other Program class fields. The command decoder tries to store the info by binding number, so when its array of 128 uniform blocks is indexed by -1414812757, it page-faults.<!----></span><br><br>I don't currently see any way how it could be exploited to not crash the GPU process and return any useful data back to the JS code. That and the imminent switch to SwANGLE makes me consider this a WontFix.<span class="line"><!---->I don't currently see any way how it could be exploited to not crash the GPU process and return any useful data back to the JS code. That and the imminent switch to SwANGLE makes me consider this a WontFix.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

          Comment 28<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1193104#c28">Comment 28<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden="">schedule</i>
      capn@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/2929596023" title="capn@chromium.org"><!---->capn@chromium.org<!----></a>
      capn@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->capn@chromium.org<!----></span>
      Last visit > 30 days ago<div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden=""><!---->Last visit &gt; 30 days ago<!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Thu, Jun 3, 2021, 4:13 PM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jun 3, 2021, 4:13 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1193104#c28">Comment 28<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jun 3, 2021, 4:13 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1193104#c28">Comment 28<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, Jun 3, 2021, 4:13 PM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          WontFix
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          FoundIn-92
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          WontFix
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          FoundIn-92
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        This is a bug in the legacy SwiftShader OpenGL ES implementation. Note that ClusterFuzz is already switched to using SwANGLE, which is not affected, and hence it didn't reproduce it. We're switching to SwANGLE as WebGL fallback any day now, so that will address this bug.<span class="line"><!---->This is a bug in the legacy SwiftShader OpenGL ES implementation. Note that ClusterFuzz is already switched to using SwANGLE, which is not affected, and hence it didn't reproduce it. We're switching to SwANGLE as WebGL fallback any day now, so that will address this bug.<!----></span><br><br>The issue appears to be that the declared array of 128 uniform blocks is counted as 'active', despite not being used anywhere in the shader. The validating command decoder queries info on all active uniform blocks, such as the binding number, but legacy SwiftShader has only GL_MAX_UNIFORM_BUFFER_BINDINGS = 24 of them. Thus the bindings array is accessed out of bounds, producing values such as -1414812757, obtained from other Program class fields. The command decoder tries to store the info by binding number, so when its array of 128 uniform blocks is indexed by -1414812757, it page-faults.<span class="line"><!---->The issue appears to be that the declared array of 128 uniform blocks is counted as 'active', despite not being used anywhere in the shader. The validating command decoder queries info on all active uniform blocks, such as the binding number, but legacy SwiftShader has only GL_MAX_UNIFORM_BUFFER_BINDINGS = 24 of them. Thus the bindings array is accessed out of bounds, producing values such as -1414812757, obtained from other Program class fields. The command decoder tries to store the info by binding number, so when its array of 128 uniform blocks is indexed by -1414812757, it page-faults.<!----></span><br><br>I don't currently see any way how it could be exploited to not crash the GPU process and return any useful data back to the JS code. That and the imminent switch to SwANGLE makes me consider this a WontFix.<span class="line"><!---->I don't currently see any way how it could be exploited to not crash the GPU process and return any useful data back to the JS code. That and the imminent switch to SwANGLE makes me consider this a WontFix.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */

          position: relative;
        }

          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;

          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
